summary: This document is a set of administrative logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York concerning the suicide watch of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. It includes a chronological log, observation logs, and notes about a procedural error where the wrong log book was initially used. The observation log details Epstein's activities in his cell on the morning of July 23, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who is the subject of the suicide watch logs at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. His activities are documented in the observation log.

persons.name: Charisma Edge
persons.context: Associate Warden at MCC New York. The chronological log is addressed to them regarding a procedural error with the suicide watch log.

connections.description: Edge, as Associate Warden, is the supervisory official to whom the log concerning inmate Epstein's suicide watch procedures is addressed.

events.title: Epstein Suicide Watch Observations
events.description: Detailed 15-minute observations of inmate Jeffrey Epstein's activities in his cell while on suicide watch, including lying on bed, standing at door, and picking at items.

events.title: Log Error Discovery and Correction
events.description: A staff member notes that the wrong log book (Inmate Companions Log) was initially used for Epstein's suicide watch instead of the proper Staff Suicide Watch Observation Log. The error was corrected.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on a formal suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York.
A procedural error occurred where staff initially used an 'Inmate Companions Log' instead of the proper 'Staff Suicide Watch Observation Log' for documenting observations.
The observation log for the morning of July 23, 2019, shows Epstein alternating between lying on his bed and standing at his cell door.
The document is a chronological administrative record created on August 12, 2019, documenting and correcting the log-keeping procedures related to Epstein's custody.
The log requires observations to be documented every 15 minutes, indicating a high level of monitoring for an inmate on suicide watch.
